title: Graphic "Ostalgie" graphic design and typography in the DDR
content:
Hi,  
I'm looking for pictures of the old DDR (graphic design, posters, corporate identities, posters and typefaces). In particular I am interested in examples of typography Maxima Grotesk Gert Wunderlich.

Someone can send me pictures?

thanks
author: marcosdopico

comments.content:
Thank you Andreas,  
can I use this imagen in a publication?

Yes, you can use it. Search for the phrase " [DEWAG](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018061209/http:/images.google.ch/images?hl=de&um=1&q=DEWAG+-GmbH+-KG+-AG&sa=N&start=20&ndsp=20)" on google & co., this was the name of the "creative" department/organisation in the GDR. I think were was nothing that we should call "corporate design" in the GDR. This thin folder for the 750 Berlin anniversary is a very late sample of a major national advertising project and can't be used as representative for design in the GDR at all.

BTW. I don't know of many samples for the usage of Maxima in ordinary live.

-- [astype.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018061209/http:/www.astype.de/)--
